channel.title: US relinquishes control of the internet
channel.description: http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/2009/sep/30/icann-agreement-us I thought this was pretty interesting, although as with many news articles the comments section has a few idiots...

item.title: US relinquishes control of the internet
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Lothy:

Uhh, we invented the Victor lawn mower and that spinning washing line (which probably increases the rate at which clothes dry when hung outside by an arbitrary percentage).

I suppose a spinning washing line would have been useful before that one thing…

Oh yea, a clothes dryer?

Read full topic
item.source: US relinquishes control of the internet

@T41 wrote:

I wonder if this will limit Hollywood’s grip on the internet.

Read full topic

item.source: US relinquishes control of the internet

item.title: US relinquishes control of the internet
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:13, topic:306443”]Uhh, we invented the Victor lawn mower and that spinning washing line (which probably increases the rate at which clothes dry when hung outside by an arbitrary percentage).

Seriously, tonnes of things have come from Australia. For example, the university that I study at takes part in the robotics soccer tournaments – and performs well. Maybe not an invention, per se, but certainly an important contribution.
I believe there was some sort of device being invented here that could receive and resend messages received from a fibre optic cable, without first converting the light into electricity and then back into light. Something like that, anyway. It was a long time ago that I stumbled upon the article.[/quote]
i didn’t say you didn’t contribute just that you didnt invent anything useful

Read full topic
item.source: US relinquishes control of the internet

@haticks wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:13, topic:306443”]Uhh, we invented the Victor lawn mower and that spinning washing line (which probably increases the rate at which clothes dry when hung outside by an arbitrary percentage).

Seriously, tonnes of things have come from Australia. For example, the university that I study at takes part in the robotics soccer tournaments – and performs well. Maybe not an invention, per se, but certainly an important contribution.
I believe there was some sort of device being invented here that could receive and resend messages received from a fibre optic cable, without first converting the light into electricity and then back into light. Something like that, anyway. It was a long time ago that I stumbled upon the article.[/quote]offtopic: Im playing against the Australian National basketball team dec 15th.

item.title: US relinquishes control of the internet
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Stop arguing, we can’t agree on who actually made the internet so from here on out God made it. We shall re-print all bibles and change all churches.

Read full topic
item.source: US relinquishes control of the internet

item.title: US relinquishes control of the internet
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Uhh, we invented the Victor lawn mower and that spinning washing line (which probably increases the rate at which clothes dry when hung outside by an arbitrary percentage).

Seriously, tonnes of things have come from Australia. For example, the university that I study at takes part in the robotics soccer tournaments – and performs well. Maybe not an invention, per se, but certainly an important contribution.
I believe there was some sort of device being invented here that could receive and resend messages received from a fibre optic cable, without first converting the light into electricity and then back into light. Something like that, anyway. It was a long time ago that I stumbled upon the article.

Read full topic
item.source: US relinquishes control of the internet

item.title: US relinquishes control of the internet
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:11, topic:306443”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=402612.msg2986263#msg2986263 date=1255007218]

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Berners-Lee

I thought the internet was invented by the British?

Yeah? Well I thought only Australians could invent something so useful.
[/quote]
iirc you australians havnt invented anything useful[/quote]
what about that piece of wood you throw that comes back and hits you in the face?

Read full topic

item.title: US relinquishes control of the internet
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:306443”][quote author=TheBeanie link=topic=402612.msg2986110#msg2986110 date=1254984594]

en.wikipedia.org

Tim Berners-Lee

Sir Timothy John Berners-Lee OM KBE FRS FREng FRSA FBCS (born 8 June 1955), also known as TimBL, is an English engineer and computer scientist, best known as the inventor of the World Wide Web. He is currently a professor of Computer Science at the University of Oxford and at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). He made a proposal for an information management system in March 1989, and he implemented the first successful communication between a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HT Berners-L...

I thought the internet was invented by the British?
[/quote]
Yeah? Well I thought only Australians could invent something so useful.[/quote]
iirc you australians havnt invented anything useful
